newsitem.title: JAPAN: Yamaichi Sec says finds no sokaiya-related account.
newsitem.headline: Yamaichi Sec says finds no sokaiya-related account.

text.p: Yamaichi Securities Co Ltd said on Tuesday that it was conducting an in-house investigation and had so far not found any accounts linking the firm to "sokaiya" corporate racketeers.
Yamaichi has not been investigated by Japan's securities watchdog, the Securities and Exchange Surveillance Commission (SESC), vice president Ryuji Shirai said at a news conference.
"We are conducting an in-house investigation and we have so far found no illegal accounts. We have not been investigated by the SESC," Shirai said.
Japan's stock markets have become particularly edgy over any brokerage links with sokaiya racketeers since the recent scandal at Nomura Securities Co Ltd over suspected illegal deals.

Last week two Nomura directors resigned after the brokerage firm said they made apparently illegal deals and funnelled funds to a corporate client that has been linked by Japanese media to a former sokaiya racketeer.
Separately, Yamaichi said in a statement that the company would sell land in central Tokyo on March 31 for 9.23 billion yen. The funds would be used to support its real estate unit, it said.
